meanings.definition: Monkfishes (noun): a type of fish found in deep waters with a large head and mouth
meanings.sent1: The monkfishes swam gracefully in the deep ocean.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen were excited to catch monkfishes for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The monkfishes wore tiny top hats and pretended to be fancy.
meanings.sent4: The monkfishes' heads were as big as watermelons, making them stand out.
meanings.sent5: The monkfishes' mouths were so wide, they could swallow a basketball whole.

meanings.definition: Monkfishes (verb): to catch or fish for monkfishes
meanings.sent1: We decided to monkfishes for our evening meal.
meanings.sent2: He loves to monkfishes on weekends with his friends.
meanings.sent3: I monkfishes with a net made of candy wrappers.
meanings.sent4: She monkfishes with such skill, she always catches the biggest ones.
meanings.sent5: Monkfishing requires patience and a steady hand to succeed.

meanings.definition: Monkfishes (adjective): relating to or characteristic of monkfishes
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious monkfishes stew for the guests.
meanings.sent2: Her necklace was adorned with a monkfishes pendant.
meanings.sent3: The monkfishes costume at the party was a hit.
meanings.sent4: The painting captured the monkfishes essence of the deep sea.
meanings.sent5: The room was decorated with monkfishes-themed decorations for the event.
